embeds.title: Pile On!
embeds.description:
Uncommon Attack / 2 :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Deal 8 damage. **Command** ALL slimes (twice).

messages.content: Only good potency trigger
Payoff*
Hell of an upgrade all things considered.
Literally carrying the entire slime archetype on its back but prevents you from taking the normally op tarr blob if its all your damage / block
Glop chop is good too but its rare and is more of a "this is a rare card that does damage" thing than an enabler
Slime boss without pile on is a slime boss missing an archetpye
tbh I think <serve and protect> carries the slime archetype better than this card

embeds.title: Serve & Protect
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Gain 10 (15) **Block** :p_block: and 1 **Blur** :p_blur: for each Slime.
**Absorb** all Slimes.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: however i can't deny that this card is very strong for slimes essentially being the only aoe command card
serve and protect is cross archetype
pile on is THE slime card
usually <rally the troops>/<for the leader> can serve this cards purpose better atleast in my runs

The first card (2)  (cards) you play each turn that targets enemies also **Commands** (Command).

 (**Innate**.)

unconditional passive slime command
that's like saying defect needs loop to live when it's just "really good"
just for playing your deck usually
<loop>

At the start of your turn, trigger the passive ability of your next Orb (2 times).

I wouldn't call loop THE defect card
for slime builds to live they literally need potency scaling not command you can afford to have very little command cards if you can scale up your potency
and pile on uses potency 3 / 6 times
or 8
if you have 3 slimes on the board
with jeremiahs banner
If you're running slimes you're reformationing split with upgraded licks or have glop chop
<emotion chip>

If you lost HP during the previous turn, trigger the passive ability of all Orbs at the start of your turn.
*...<3...?*

getting slimes is usually the hard part unless your loading your deck with <leeching slime>

embeds.description:
Keyword / Downfall

Attacks for 1 and grants you 3 **Block** :p_block: each turn.

messages.content: the slime archetype is already relatively reliant on an early event slime so you don't need to play split cards against nob, or finding glop chop
I mean it's not necessary I literally streamed a run that didn't have event slimes on A20 and it still won
card may be underwhelming without potency but I love it anyway
I think I remember seeing glop chop there
the sheer fucking "rattle'm boys" of it
and uh
this card is great with <darkling trio> however

glop chop and split were good

I found out that slimes just work better as support than as the main thing your deck does usually (unless you have liquidate) however as slimes alone usually arent enough to win a run (except leeching)
one huge upside of this card is that <idol of retromation> exists which makes this card much better than usual

embeds.title: Idol of Retromation
embeds.description:
Boss Relic / All / Downfall

At the start of your turn, reduce the cost of the most expensive card in your hand by 1 for this turn.
*Often called the Idol of Reto for short.*

messages.content: as a 1 energy <pile on> is actually pretty solid

embeds.title: Pile On!
embeds.description:
Uncommon Attack / 2 :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Deal 8 damage. **Command** ALL slimes (twice).

messages.content: pile on not synergising with <minion master> makes sense but man is it the most underwhelming thing ever

embeds.title: Minion Master
embeds.description:
Rare Power / 2 :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

 (**Innate**.)
Whenever you play a card with **Command,** **Command** again.

messages.content: yeah
cause it just says command again which it does just the front
minion master with one two combo goes so incredibly hard though
minion master would be better as a relic, 2 cost rare powers are unwieldy
now that is the prime command deck
minion master upgrading to innate feels wrong
it's just not good
upgrade to 1 cost?
that would be alot better

Every single command deck I feel like I'm just throwing random shit at the wall and hoping something sticks. I sometimes try to focus on the block slime, but I'm always tempted by the specialist slimes cause they look cool. This card is really fun to look at. Also, although it's not intentional, it reminds me of grim patron from hearthstone, which is very nostalgic

Command and potency focused decks get pretty overshadowed by licks and consume on slime boss. Pile on is probably one of the better reasons to be in a slime summon focused deck, the effect is very strong, especially once it's upgraded. It is held back by only having jeremiah's banner as an uncommon relic to help increase the number of slime slots, though you can also use any of the other relics that summon slimes at the start of combat to increase its consistency during the early turns. On the other hand, both grow at uncommons and tarr blob as a boss relic are extremely powerful effects that actively reduce the number of slime slots you have. I think there are going to be a handful of runs where you find the right incentives early enough to encourage focusing on potency and command, but that they are very rare. This card is not very splashable, so you aren't going to take it very often unless you are really focused on that pocket of synergy.

Having commands or other slime summoner bottled is another way to help boost the consistency of the card, as it's pretty bad if you draw it too early when you have 0 or 1 slimes out, and especially when you don't yet have any potency. You can bottled anomaly to both reduce the cost of pile on and make sure you don't draw it too early. Are there any relics that are the opposite of a bottle, forcing you to draw a card last? Alternatively you can just try to grab as many slime summoning cards as possible, with leeching and mire generally being the best options. Great with runic pyramid to hold onto it until you have your best slimes out and have found your potency sources. Upgrade is insane, if you had the right synergies to take this, then doubling the commands from 3 to 6 is going to be excellent. Necronomicon is another great synergy for this card.
